subject: Art & Design
title: Why Clothes Became Fashion: From Function to Identity
description: A quick win: understand Why Clothes Became Fashion: From Function to Identity.

hook.text: Animals grow fur. Humans chose what to wear â€” and that choice became culture, status, and self-expression.

buildup.text: Early clothing served survival: protection from cold, rain, and sun. But decoration appeared almost immediately.

discovery.text: 70,000-year-old shell beads suggest humans adorned themselves long before agriculture. Fashion predates civilization.

twist.text: Function never disappeared. It just got buried. A business suit 'protects' social standing, not skin.

climax.text: Fashion is the only art form worn on the body. It's simultaneously personal expression and social communication.

punchline.text: We didn't just learn to dress. We learned to speak with fabric.

quiz.question: What do 70,000-year-old shell beads tell us about early humans?
options: Ancient humans traded shells as currency
Shell beads were used as tools, not decoration
